brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about a rule that reports the value of @DefaultValue if it cannot be converted to the specified type of parameter in RESTful Web Service (JAX-RS).
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'incorrect-default-value' checks all classes and their methods. If a method has the '@DefaultValue' annotation, it retrieves the default value and the type of the first argument of the method. It then asserts that the default value can be converted to the specified parameter type. If the conversion is not possible, it generates a message indicating the default value, the method name, the fully qualified name of the class, and the specified parameter type.
3rd-party most relevant URLs and summary:
1. URL: https://www.baeldung.com/jax-rs-defaultvalue-annotation
Summary: This page provides a detailed explanation of the @DefaultValue annotation in JAX-RS. It explains how to use it and what happens when the default value cannot be converted to the specified parameter type.

2. URL: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26777083/best-practice-for-rest-token-based-authentication-with-jax-rs-and-jersey
Summary: This StackOverflow discussion includes a question and answers about best practices for token-based authentication with JAX-RS and Jersey. It indirectly addresses the use of @DefaultValue and potential issues with incorrect default values.
